title: Arsenal Diary : What in store this week | News
body_text:
There’s plenty of football taking place across our men’s and academy sides this week, while members of our women’s squad head off on international duty.
Here’s what to look out for on Arsenal.com and the official app over the next seven days.
MONDAY
11am - Mikel Arteta press conference
Tune in for Mikel Arteta’s pre-Fulham press conference, as he returns to face the media at Sobha Realty Training Centre to look ahead to Tuesday’s game.
Find out the latest team news from our manager, hear his thoughts on Marco Silva’s side and more.
7pm - Norwich City v Arsenal U21s
Our under-21s travel east to face Norwich City at Carrow Road for a 7pm kick-off in Premier League 2.
You can watch the action live on Arsenal.com or the official app, with live commentary from Harry Symeou and Jeremie Aliadiere.
TUESDAY
11am - Arsenal U18s v Fulham
There’s more academy action on Tuesday morning as our under-18s host Fulham at Sobha Realty Training Centre.
Adam Birchall’s young Gunners are seventh in the U18 Premier League South, two points behind sixth-placed Fulham, who have played two games more.
7.45pm - Arsenal v Fulham
Fulham’s first team will also be making the trip to north London later in the day as we host the Cottagers at Emirates Stadium for a 7.45pm kick-off in the Premier League.
Fulham are eighth in the league with 45 points and are pushing to sneak into European qualification places for next season.
We will bring you all the pre-match build-up on Arsenal.com and the official app, with our matchday show Live From N5 starting an hour before kick-off. Post-match interviews, highlights and a full match replay will be published after the game.
WEDNESDAY
Women’s international preview
Members of our women’s team are heading off on international duty this month for games taking place from Wednesday, April 2 to Tuesday, April 9. Find out who has been called up on Arsenal.com.
Vote for March’s Players of the Month
Which players stood out to you with their performances in March? Let us know by casting your vote for our men’s and women’s Player of the Month awards.
FRIDAY
Time TBC - Mikel Arteta press conference
Our manager will be back in front of the media to turn his attention to Saturday’s trip to Everton. Again, you can watch the press conference live on Arsenal.com or the official app.
SATURDAY
11.30am - Leicester City v Arsenal U18s
Leicester City Training Ground is the venue for this weekend’s U18 Premier League South meeting with the Foxes, who are one position and two points below us, having played four games more.
Follow the action live on X @ArsenalAcademy or on Instagram with ‘officialarsenalacademy’.
12.30pm - Everton v Arsenal
We’re back in Premier League action with our final trip to Goodison Park before Everton move to Bramley-Moore Dock next season.
The game will be shown live on TNT Sports 1 as the Toffees look to end the season on a high.
Tune in on Arsenal.com or the official app for live match commentary. Post-match interviews, highlights and a full match replay will be published after the game.
